Let’s Talk

Section Store

Overview

Section Store is a powerful full-stack Shopify application built to provide merchants with a seamless marketplace for discovering, purchasing, and managing premium Shopify sections. Designed with scalability and user experience in mind, the app delivers a fully embedded experience within the Shopify admin, ensuring merchants can browse and install high-quality storefront sections without ever leaving their dashboard.

The platform supports two distinct user roles — merchants and admins — each with tailored dashboards and access. Merchants can explore a curated catalog of sections, complete secure purchases via Stripe or PayPal, and manage their downloaded assets through the “My Sections” dashboard. A built-in request system allows users to submit feature or section requests, enhancing engagement and feedback loops. Admin users, authenticated through secure environment-based role-checking, have access to powerful tools for managing section inventory, reviewing analytics, and moderating submissions.

From a technical standpoint, Section Store is built using the Remix framework with React on the frontend for fast rendering and modern UX. Shopify’s Polaris design system ensures the interface feels native within Shopify, while Shopify App Bridge enables embedded functionality and secure session management. On the backend, the application uses Node.js and Remix API routes, with Prisma ORM handling all database operations on a PostgreSQL backend. Payments are securely processed via Stripe and PayPal, and authentication is managed using Shopify OAuth.

The architecture is containerized with Docker for smooth local development and deployment. Modular controllers and reusable components ensure scalability, maintainability, and extensibility — allowing the platform to easily adapt to new section types, categories, or future third-party integrations.

Overall, Section Store provides an efficient and professional ecosystem for Shopify merchants to upgrade their storefronts with minimal friction, while giving administrators full control over content, payments, and user support.
